Name Rascal/Libraries/Vis/Figure/Figures/vcat

Function Figure vcat(Figures figs, FProperty props...)
Description Vertical composition of a list of figures. By default, vertical composition is horizontally centered but all horizontal alignment properties can overrule this.

When a vertical gap property is available, this will be used as gap between the figures.
Examples 
b1 = box(size(50,100), resizable(false), fillColor("Red"));
b2 = box(size(80,20), resizable(false), fillColor("Blue"));
render(vcat([b1, b2]));
gives: 

b1 = box(size(50,100), resizable(false), fillColor("Red"), left());
b2 = box(size(80,20), resizable(false), fillColor("Blue"), left());
render(vcat([b1, b2]));
gives: 



b1 = box(size(50,100), resizable(false), fillColor("Red"), right());
b2 = box(size(80,20), resizable(false), fillColor("Blue"), right());
render(vcat([b1, b2]));
gives:

When several child figures are involved, it is more convenient to change the standard alignment for them using std. 
b1 = box(size(50,100), resizable(false), fillColor("Red"));
b2 = box(size(80,20), resizable(false), fillColor("Blue"));
b3 = box(size(80,20), resizable(false), fillColor("Yellow"));
render(vcat([b1, b2, b3], std(left()), vgap(10)));
gives:
